Method Summary
static int countPaths(int[][] mat)
          countPaths: the recursive (backtracking) method returns the number of possible paths from the left upper cell in the 2d array inserted in it to the down right cell. each path countiues cell to cell by the number in it for example the cell has "15"- we can move 1 in the rows and 5 in columns or 1 in columns and 5 in the rows. the path cannot proceed the array borders.
static boolean findValTest(int[][] m, int val)
          2:findValTest: the first loop runs all over the first column and checks if val is bigger or the same then the first cell in the first row and smaller or same(that will be for must if its equal to the first cell in the upper row because of "test-true"), if the loop "catches" this two rows it will run a loop inside them both to search for the value, and if its found it will return true.
static boolean findValWhat(int[][] m, int val)
          1:findValWhat: the method starts at the right upper corner of the array if the cell's int equals to val returns true, if not and it is bigger then val it goes left in the row. if its smaller then val it goes down in the column. if the loop reaches the borders of the array without finding val it returns false.

          3.reverse: the method return an int paramter inserted in her in reverse.
static int reverseRec(int num)
          4.reverseRec: the recursive!
static int weight(int num, int digit)
          1.weight: the method checks what's the weight of the digit inserted in the num inserted that means- if the digit is in the "1" place (first time) it returns 1, "2"-10, "3"-100...
static int weightRec(int num, int digit)
          2.weightRec: the recursive!
static int what(int[] a)
          C:what: the method counts the number of even and odd numbers in the array the longest even sum is made of the sum of all the even numbers and the maximum even number of odd numbers in the array. that means-if the number of odd numbers is even we add it to the length of the sum. if it is odd-we remove 1 from it and add it to the sum.

Method Detail

countPaths

public static int countPaths(int[][] mat)
countPaths: the recursive (backtracking) method returns the number of possible paths from the left upper cell in the 2d array inserted in it to the down right cell. each path countiues cell to cell by the number in it for example the cell has "15"- we can move 1 in the rows and 5 in columns or 1 in columns and 5 in the rows. the path cannot proceed the array borders.

Parameters:
mat - the 2d array inserted.
Returns:
the number of paths possible from the left upper cell to the right down cell.

findValTest

public static boolean findValTest(int[][] m,
                                  int val)
2:findValTest: the first loop runs all over the first column and checks if val is bigger or the same then the first cell in the first row and smaller or same(that will be for must if its equal to the first cell in the upper row because of "test-true"), if the loop "catches" this two rows it will run a loop inside them both to search for the value, and if its found it will return true. if it will not find the value in the rows it cought it will never find more rows so the inner loop will run maximum 2 times.(no O(n^2))! also there is another loop that is not depended that checks the last row that might be not checked.

Parameters:
m - the 2d array that the method gets if test returns true on it.
val - the int's searched in the array
Returns:
true if the method finds val in the array.

findValWhat

public static boolean findValWhat(int[][] m,
                                  int val)
1:findValWhat: the method starts at the right upper corner of the array if the cell's int equals to val returns true, if not and it is bigger then val it goes left in the row. if its smaller then val it goes down in the column. if the loop reaches the borders of the array without finding val it returns false.

Parameters:
m - the 2d array that the method gets if what returns true on it
val - the int's searched in the array
Returns:
true if the method finds val in the array.

reverse

public static int reverse(int num)
3.reverse: the method return an int paramter inserted in her in reverse. for example "9456"- input, "6549"-output.

Parameters:
num - the number inserted to be reversed.
Returns:
the reveresed number of the parameter num.

Parameters:
num - the number inserted to be reversed.
Returns:
the reveresed number of the parameter num.

weight

public static int weight(int num,
                         int digit)
1.weight: the method checks what's the weight of the digit inserted in the num inserted that means- if the digit is in the "1" place (first time) it returns 1, "2"-10, "3"-100...

Parameters:
num - the positive int number inserted
digit - the digit inserted to find what its number in the parameter num.
Returns:
the weight of the digit in the first place in num it sees her.

weightRec

public static int weightRec(int num,
                            int digit)
2.weightRec: the recursive! method checks what's the weight of the digit inserted in the num inserted that means- if the digit is in the "1" place (first time) it returns 1, "2"-10, "3"-100...

Parameters:
num - the positive int number inserted
digit - the digit inserted to find what its number in the parameter num.
Returns:
the weight of the digit in the first place in num it sees her.

what

public static int what(int[] a)
C:what: the method counts the number of even and odd numbers in the array the longest even sum is made of the sum of all the even numbers and the maximum even number of odd numbers in the array. that means-if the number of odd numbers is even we add it to the length of the sum. if it is odd-we remove 1 from it and add it to the sum.

Parameters:
a - the 1d array that the method gets
Returns:
the length of the longest even sum possible in the array.
